fi.akash

Class TictactoeMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • fi.akash.TictactoeMain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class TictactoeMain
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Tic Tac Toe-game with graphical user interface. User plays against a computer without a proper AI. Computer's movements are random. Board size is resizable and the amount of symbols needed in a row to win, is also changeable.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    2015.1205
    Author:
    Akash Singh
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TictactoeMain

        public TictactoeMain(int size,
                     int amountToWin)
        Main frame where all the components(buttons, labels) are laid onto.
        Parameters:
        size - size of the game board.
        amountToWin - the amount of symbols needed to get in a row to win.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Is called when any button is pressed, and acts accordingly for that button.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - pressed button.

      • checkStatus

        private void checkStatus(java.lang.String winner,
                         int symbolIndex)
        Goes through a list to check if anyone has won or board is full. Is called at the end of every turn. Goes through every possible victory condition. And also checks if the board is full.
        Parameters:
        winner - name of the method caller (Player/Computer).
        symbolIndex - number that represent method caller's symbol (X/0).

      • columnWin

        private boolean columnWin(int symbolIndex)
        Checks if winning move is found in a column/vertical-shape.
        Parameters:
        symbolIndex - number that represent method caller's symbol (X/0).
        Returns:
        true = found a winning move, false = winning move was not found.

      • rowWin

        private boolean rowWin(int symbolIndex)
        Checks if winning move is found in a row/horizontal-shape.
        Parameters:
        symbolIndex - number that represent method caller's symbol (X/0).
        Returns:
        true = found a winning move, false = winning move was not found.

      • diagonalWin

        private boolean diagonalWin(int symbolIndex)
        Checks if winning move is found in a diagonal-shape.
        Parameters:
        symbolIndex - number that represent method caller's symbol (X/0).
        Returns:
        true = found a winning move, false = winning move was not found.

      • noMoreSlots

        private boolean noMoreSlots()
        Checks if there is pressable buttons. If there is no buttons left to press, the game ends.
        Returns:
        true = buttons left to press, false = no buttons left to press.

      • playerClick

        private void playerClick(int row,
                         int column)
        When the player clicks a button. Player clicks a button. Leaves a symbol to that button and disables it from further pressing. Checks status for wins or if the board is full. Next: computer makes a move.
        Parameters:
        row - pressed button's row number.
        column - pressed buttons's column number.

      • computerTurn

        private void computerTurn()
        When the computer clicks a button. This is called after a player has pressed a button. Checks if there are any pressable buttons, if so, continue normally, if not, skip turn. Randomly picks a button to press. Leaves a symbol to that button and disables it from further pressing. Checks status for wins or if the board is full.

      • endOfTheGame

        private void endOfTheGame(java.lang.String status)
        Ends the game, prevents any further clicking. This is called if winner is found or board is full. Stops the game. Announces the result. Disables rest of the non-disabled buttons.
        Parameters:
        status - current situation of the game, in a plain text.

      • reset

        private void reset()
        Resets the game with current settings. This is called when user presses the newGame-button. Reset buttons to their original state.

      • buttonReset

        private void buttonReset(boolean enable,
                         java.lang.String s)
        Enables all buttons or disables all buttons. Used with reset(enable) and endOfTheGame(disable).
        Parameters:
        enable - true = enable all buttons, false = disable all buttons.
        s - determines method caller.

      • setStatus

        private void setStatus(java.lang.String status)
        Sets status for statusLabel for player to see the current situation of the game.
        Parameters:
        status - current situation of the game, in a plain text.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Entry point of the application.
        Parameters:
        args - not used.
